summary: Tom Moore was a staffer for the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI) in 1976. He is mentioned in NSA memoranda related to the SSCI's investigation into Cuban intelligence networks and the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. Specifically, Moore, along with Howard Liebengood, met with NSA's John C. Wobensmith to review an NSA product on Antonio Veciana. This meeting led to the SSCI requesting a review of all Cuban material from 1961-1965, indicating Moore's involvement in directing the scope of the SSCI's inquiry into potential Cuban connections to the JFK assassination.
significance: Tom Moore's significance lies in his role as an SSCI staffer involved in requesting and reviewing information related to Antonio Veciana and Cuban intelligence activities during the period relevant to the JFK assassination. His actions helped shape the direction of the SSCI's investigation into potential Cuban involvement.
